channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bill Gates said he wished he learned this lesson from Warren Buffett sooner: The power of an 'intentionally light' calendar
item.description: "In hindsight, it’s a lesson I could have learned a lot sooner had I taken more peeks at Warren Buffett’s intentionally light calendar."

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Tuesday
item.description: Here are the most important news items that investors need to start their trading day.

item.title: Glass Lewis urges Tesla shareholders to block Musk’s $56 billion pay package
While American companies go quiet on climate change, Europeans keep banging the drum
item.description: One-pager: Concerns over culture wars and ESG investment backlash are stronger factors in the U.S. than Europe, which may lead to further divergence on net zero trajectories.

item.title: GameStop shares rise 25% in premarket trading after $933 million stock sale
item.description: Shares in GameStop gained in premarket trading on Tuesday after the company announced Friday that it had made $933 million from a stock sale.

item.title: GameStop shares surge after completing stock offering
'Rational' monetary policies are back, says Turkey's finance chief, as he seeks to stabilize inflation-ridden economy
item.description: Turkey had kept interest rates low amid soaring inflation, against conventional wisdom, leading investors to desert its bond market.

item.title: 'This can no longer be justified': Anger over Rafah attack piles more pressure on Israel
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described the attack as a tragic error.

item.title: Here’s what summer prices look like for groceries, gas, utilities and more
American company tells Mexico president that his $385m offer to buy its Caribbean property for ecotourism 'substantially undervalues' its crocodile-filled quarries
item.description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has threatened to expropriate the property, claiming the pits it has dug to extract crushed limestone have damaged the area's fragile system of underground rivers and caves.

item.title: Tuesday's analyst calls: Cruise stock gets an upgrade, regional bank to rally 30%
item.description: A major cruise line operator and a bank in the Midwest were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Tuesday.

item.title: Stocks are making Americans feel richer — and the Fed’s inflation fight harder
Wisconsin law that banned collective bargaining for most public employees back in court
item.description: The court is controlled 4-3 by liberals, a flip from when it upheld the law a decade ago under 5-2 conservative control.

item.title: Fed's Kashkari wants to see 'many more months' of positive inflation data before a rate cut
item.description: The Federal Reserve should wait for significant progress on inflation before cutting rates, Minneapolis Federal Reserve President Neel Kashkari said Tuesday.

item.title: Some buzzy AI names highlight this week’s earnings slate — along with Costco
